citation.article-title: Coprobacillus catenaformis gen. nov., sp. nov., a new genus and species isolated from human feces.

p.s: Coprobacillus (Copro.ba.cil'lus, L. n. Copro, feces; L. dim. N. bacillus a small rod; M.L. n. Coprobacillus rodlet isolated from feces)
Cells occur in the chains of cocci cells, and are Gram-positive and obligatorily anaerobic.
Fermentation products of glucose are mainly acetic and lactic acids.
DNA G + C content is 32 to 34 mol%.
The type species is Coprobacillus catenaformis.
The genus Coprobacillus is a member of the Clostridium subphylum of Gram-positive bacteria and exhibits a close phylogenetic association with C. ramosum and C. spiroforme.
